answer is A, A. by using Hosts page in the Investigate tool

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. by using Hosts page in the Investigate tool

Here's why the other options are incorrect:

B. Groups in Host Management: This section focuses on managing groups of endpoints within CrowdStrike, not identifying neighboring devices.
C. Sensor Visibility Exclusions Audit: This audit helps identify exclusions for CrowdStrike sensors, not neighboring devices.
D. Event Search: While event data might contain information about device interactions, it wouldn't provide a consolidated view of managed and unmanaged neighbors like the Investigate tool.

Selected Answer: A
Host Search displays all unmanaged neighbors detected in past 24h.
A is correct

Selected Answer: B
checked in the docs

choices.B: by reviewing "Groups" in Host Management under the Hosts page
choices.D: only by searching event data using Event Search
choices.A: by using Hosts page in the Investigate tool
choices.C: under "Audit" by running Sensor Visibility Exclusions Audit

questions.question_text: A list of managed and unmanaged neighbors for an endpoint can be found:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer is C, C. It excludes sensor monitoring and event collection for the trusted file path

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is:

C. It excludes sensor monitoring and event collection for the trusted file path

Here's why the other options are incorrect:

A. Excludes host information: This wouldn't be the primary function of a sensor visibility exclusion.
B. Prevents file uploads: Sensor visibility exclusions focus on monitoring, not file transfer.
D. Disables detection but allows prevention: While this might be intuitive, sensor visibility exclusions typically disable both detection and prevention for the excluded path.
Creating a sensor visibility exclusion essentially tells the security software to trust a specific file path and not monitor activity there. This can improve performance but also creates a blind spot for potential threats in that location.

Selected Answer: C
The point of SVE is to disable event monitoring, which could also contribute to option A.

Selected Answer: B
only one possible

comments.content: You seem to consistently provide inaccurate answers.

choices.D: It disables detection generation from that path, however the sensor can still perform prevention actions
choices.C: It excludes sensor monitoring and event collection for the trusted file path
choices.B: It prevents file uploads to the CrowdStrike cloud from that file path
choices.A: It excludes host information from Detections and Incidents generated within that file path location

questions.question_text: What happens when you create a Sensor Visibility Exclusion for a trusted file path?
Aside from a Process Timeline or Event Search, how do you export process event data from a detection in .CSV format?

choices.A: You can’t export detailed event data from a detection, you have to use the Process Timeline or an Event Search
choices.D: From the Detections Dashboard, you right-click the event type you wish to export and choose CSV, JSON or XML
choices.B: In Full Detection Details, you expand the nodes of the process tree you wish to expand and then click the "Export Process Events" button
choices.C: In Full Detection Details, you choose the "View Process Activity" option and then export from that view

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I pick C

D is not correct, refer to document, it only can export CSV orJSON, but not XML.

Falcon Documentation > Falcon Management > Falcon Console User Guide.

Data export, In many apps, you can export data on the screen to CSV or JSON format by clicking the export button

Selected Answer: C
Process Activity shows Event Type data while Process Tree shows Triggering Files.

questions.question_text: The Falcon platform will show a maximum of how many detections per day for a single Agent Identifier (AID)?

choices.C: Local Prevalence is the Virus Total score for the hash of the triggering file
choices.A: Local prevalence is the frequency with which the hash of the triggering file is seen across the entire Internet
choices.B: Local Prevalence tells you how common the hash of the triggering file is within your environment (CID)
choices.D: Local prevalence is the frequency with which the hash of the triggering file is seen across all CrowdStrike customer environments

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Global Prevalence and Local Prevalence are two fields that provide information about how common or rare a file is based on its hash value.

Global Prevalence tells you how frequently the hash of the triggering file is seen across all CrowdStrike customer environments.
Local Prevalence tells you how frequently the hash of the triggering file is seen within your environment (CID).

These fields can help you assess the risk and impact of a detection.

Selected Answer: B
Answer agree with B

But in 2024, the portal, changed the name to "Internal prevalence" and "external prevalence"

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is:

B. Local Prevalence tells you how common the hash of the triggering file is within your environment (CID).

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. Definition - Global Prevalence is how common the triggering file is across our entire customer base. Local Prevalence is how common the triggering file is across your org.

Selected Answer: B
It's B

questions.question_text: When looking at the details of a detection, there are two fields called Global Prevalence and Local Prevalence. Which answer best defines Local Prevalence?
